name: I.Q Mania
summary: I.Q Mania is a compilation of the entire Intelligent Qube series (Intelligent Qube, I.Q Final, I.Q Remix) in one package for PSP. It also includes ad-hoc multiplayer and a new survival mode.

name: I.Q Remix+: Intelligent Qube
summary: The sequel to the challenging PSOne cult favorite Intelligent Qube, I.Q. REMIX + is a superior puzzle game that confronts players with a simple proposition: don't fall off their platform. The catch, of course, is that the grid-based platform that they inhabit is populated with constantly moving blocks that must be successfully navigated to avoid being pushed off. New features over the PlayStation original include updated graphics, improved special effects, and additional game modes such as simultaneous two-person play. Released exclusively in Japan.

name: IQ Test
summary: Tap your way through tons of test questions and try to get the fastest time!

name: iQuiz
summary: Test your knowledge with iQuiz, a rhythm-based question-and-answer game for your iPod. Test your knowledge on songs, albums, and artists present on your iPod and take on challenges with questions about cinema, music, and television. Create your own personalized Trivia Packs to share, and play with those created by other players.

name: IQ Test
summary: Free Visual IQ Test. One of the tests for the level of intelligence is the Raven test - method of testing IQ, developed in 1936 by J.. Raven

name: IQ Safari: Playful Math with Leo
IQ Jump
summary:
A collection of 5 brain training style games which came pre-installed in the console GP2X Wiz. The games include:
Look for the same pictures
Look for the missing number
Addition and Subtraction
Look for the coin in the saving pocket
Crisis Ladder

name: IQ Dungeon
summary: Defeat the demon king and save the world with your brain! Explore the world of an RPG that will test your brain. Over 200 levels available to play!

name: I.Q Intelligent Qube
summary:
I.Q Intelligent Qube is a test of intelligence created by a higher power than ourselves. Your objective: destroy huge, deadly cubes as they roll relentlessly towards you and clear a path through the onslaught simply to survive.

Experience I.Q Intelligent Qube originally released on the PlayStation console, enhanced with up-rendering, rewind, quick save, and custom video filters.

name: IQ Ball
summary:
Your goal is to get the little purple IQ Ball critter to the target. To do this, you shoot out with his grabber and latch onto things to move him along towards his goal.

The fewer the moves you use, the better!

name: I.Q. 180
summary: The title screen shows us 25 letters of the alphabet (where did the Z go?) and 5 symbols, representing little figures. If you press F1 to start, you will see the first screen with all the letters and symbols randomly presented and numbered from 1 to 30. If you move the blinking cursor with your joystick down (in the direction of the red arrows), the second screen will appear with the same letters and symbols also numbered 1 to 30, but in a different order. You will also be confronted by a horrible tune. While the tune is playing, you will have to memorize the positions of the letters and symbols of both the screens by looking at their corresponding number (use your joystick to move the cursor in the direction of the arrows to let the other screen appear) or just write down the thirty letters and symbols of one screen on a piece of paper. When the tune stops, all the letters and symbols of both screens will change into little squares and a timer will count down from 1000 to 0. You have to memory match the same letters (or symbols) by pressing fire when your cursor is on the correct square. When two letters (or symbols) match, you will get 1 point and the two matching letters (or symbols) will stay on screen. When the two letters (or symbols) don't match, they will change into little squares again. If you manage to match all the thirty letters and symbols before the timer reaches zero, you will be confronted by another horrible tune and the game will end. If you do not manage to match all the thirty letters and symbols before the timer reaches zero, you will still be confronted by the same horrible tune and the game will end. When the game has ended you are still able to move the cursor and change squares into letters (or symbols).

name: iQuest Math: Grade 5
summary: iQuest Math: Grade 5 is an educational math game released for the LeapFrog iQuest handheld system.

name: iQuest Math: Grades 6-8
summary: iQuest Math: Grades 6-8 is an educational math game released for the LeapFrog iQuest handheld system. It is a continuation of iQuest Math: Grade 5 for ages 11-14.

name: iQuest Science: Grade 5
summary: iQuest Science: Grade 5 is an educational science game released for the LeapFrog iQuest handheld system targeted towards kids aged 10-11.

name: iQuest Science: Grades 6-8
summary: iQuest Science: Grades 6-8 is an educational science game released for the LeapFrog iQuest handheld system targeted towards kids aged 11-14.

name: iQuest Starter Pack Cartridge
summary: iQuest Starter Pack Cartridge is a game bundled in with the LeapFrog iQuest handheld system.

name: iQuest Social Studies: Grades 6-8
summary: iQuest Social Studies: Grades 6-8 is an educational game based around social studies released for the LeapFrog iQuest handheld system targeted towards kids aged 11-14.

name: iQuest Social Studies: Grade 5
summary: iQuest Social Studies: Grade 5 is an educational game based around social studies released for the LeapFrog iQuest handheld system targeted towards kids aged 10-11.
